taxonomy.title: Use or Context
taxonomy.description: This facet describes what an object is in terms of why it was created (e.g., baskets for storing food), or in what context it was used (e.g., in religious ceremonies). The organization is based upon the range of human activities.
taxonomy.notes: The primary organization is the context and use, and so a very broad concept like basket appears in several contexts: food storage baskets, baby baskets, seed gathering baskets, etc.

heading.title: Ben Franklin Half Dollar, Uncirculated Mint Set
